subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... JUnit can do this already. You just use a TestSetup decorator for the TestSuite, and then JUnit won t run the tests in the class, if that s a required
messageBody:
Cedric wrote:
> Yup, this would be a great improvement. And while we're
> at it, have JUnit not run any test in this class and
> subclasses when this happens.

JUnit can do this already. You just use a TestSetup
decorator for the TestSuite, and then JUnit won't run the
tests in the class, if that's a required feature for you.

Robert.
